programme.desc: Celebrities undertake some of the most perilous journeys in the world. Comedians Ed Byrne and Andy Parsons drive along Siberia's M56 Kolyma highway, known as the 'Road of Bones'. Along the way, they brave sub-zero temperatures, traverse icy routes, encounter deserted gulags and meet the locals who inhabit the frozen wilderness, but despite picking up practical tips for survival, the duo feel they are out of their depth.

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Broadcasters Sue Perkins and Liza Tarbuck drive along the Ho Chi Minh Trail, a network of roads and paths in Southeast Asia that was littered with unexploded bombs following the Vietnam War. Their journey takes them through jungles and mountains to some of the least-explored corners of Laos and Vietnam, and proves to be a gruelling test of their bravery, motoring skills and senses of humour.

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Hugh Dennis and David Baddiel travel along more than 1,200 miles of hazardous roads in Ethiopia on a journey to Aksum, the country's holiest place. However, they have to contend with more than fatigue and unreliable terrain to reach their destination, as they encounter drug-taking truck drivers, suffer a disastrous breakdown and start to run out of fuel at the worst possible time.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, James May and Richard Hammond compete in a land race from Resolute, Canada, to the North Pole in their most ambitious challenge to date. Pitting horse power against dog power they travel 450 miles across mountainous land masses and jagged sea ice at temperatures as low as minus 65C.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Presenters Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May are challenged to build a bridge over the River Kwai in Thailand. In order to do that, however, they have to drive across Burma, a country that has been largely closed to Westerners for more than 40 years, and must make the trip in three lorries, each bought sight unseen from the internet on a limited budget. What follows is an epic journey of beautiful scenery, regular adversity, ongoing malfunction and the constant bickering of the three men.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner returns with the light-hearted panel show in which three celebrities argue the case for having their pet hates banished for ever to the fictional room. In the opening show, the big names with an even bigger axe to grind are one-time Doctor Who and Broadchurch star David Tennant, veteran broadcaster Trevor McDonald, and actress, writer and comedian Aisling Bea. Sushi, flossing, pigeons, lateness and queuing are just some of the things that get this trio's backs up - but who will Frank decide has made the most persuasive argument?.

programme.title: Room 101

programme.title: Room 101

programme.desc: Actor Danny Dyer takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from November 2018, with comedian Sara Pascoe and tennis coach Judy Murray joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts an extended edition of the notoriously obscure quiz show, in which he awards points for answers he finds most interesting. This edition sees Bill Bailey, Jo Brand and Greg Davies join regular panellist Alan Davies to tackle miscellaneous marriage and mating matters.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Guests James Acaster, Dane Baptiste, Rob Beckett, Ed Byrne and Holly Walsh join host Dara O Briain and regular Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at events from July 2016 through the medium of games and discussion.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Guests Angela Barnes, Rob Beckett, Ed Byrne, Milton Jones and Miles Jupp join host Dara O Briain and regular Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at the week's events through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Multi-terrain board sports push Tim and Gendle to their limits, including high speed slaloms and an attempt at the world's first dry ski loop the loop.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The Falkirk wheel is the first and only rotating boat lift, capable of moving 600 tonnes of boat and water over a 25-metre height difference in just minutes.

programme.title: Medieval Murder Mysteries
programme.sub-title: The Princes in The Tower: Royal Blood
programme.desc: Examining the case of the princes in the tower, and questioning whether or not Richard III ordered their deaths.

programme.title: Medieval Murder Mysteries
programme.sub-title: Amy Dudley: The Queen, Her Lover, and His Wife
programme.desc: The suspicious death of Elizabethan noblewoman Amy Dudley, the wife of Robert Dudley, the favourite and alleged lover of Queen Elizabeth I and the man the monarch is said to have wanted to marry - if only he had been available. Amy's body was found at the foot of the stairs at Cumnor Place, her home in Oxfordshire in 1560, and her death caused a scandal - with the finger of blame pointed firmly at Dudley.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Churchills
programme.desc: Historian David Starkey profiles two of Britain's greatest wartime leaders. He begins by revealing how Winston Churchill came to write a biography of his ancestor John, who led the nation against Louis XIV of France. Starkey also explores how preparations for the Second World War were affected by the prime minister's knowledge of his 17th-century forebear's achievements.

programme.title: The Churchills
programme.desc: Historian David Starkey explains how writing a biography of his ancestor John, the first Duke of Marlborough, changed the way Winston Churchill was seen by the public and politicians, and so paved the way for his return to power. The first volume, published in 1933, reinforced the perception of him as a man past his time. But it was the second instalment, depicting John Churchill's march to the Danube and victory at Blenheim, which began to mark out Winston as the only leading politician who truly knew war.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The months following prime minister Neville Chamberlain's declaration of war against Germany, in which the only casualties on the home front were those who had to endure the blackouts. Elsewhere in Europe, the Nazi war machine cut a swathe of destruction. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How, in 1940, the French Army suffered a heavy defeat after underestimating the Nazis' strength while relying on First World War strategies and equipment to defend its frontiers. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The drop in morale of Churchill's forces following the fall of France to Nazi forces during the Second World War, and how the Dunkirk evacuation and the Battle of Britain helped to restore British confidence. Plus, America's reasons for initially refusing to enter the conflict.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: An account of Hitler's decision to invade the Soviet Union, which produced an initial series of dazzling victories until the harsh winter of 1941 took hold, with fatal consequences for the ill-equipped German army. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Laurence Olivier narrates this documentary chronicling events leading up to the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbour on December 7, 1941, and the subsequent collapse of unprepared British forces before the advancing enemy in Singapore. Includes interviews with veterans from both sides.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A delightful collection of British classics comes up for auction, including an Austin A35 and a Hillman Avenger Estate in stunning condition. An E-Type Jaguar also hits the auction.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A widow reluctantly parts with her husband's treasured collection of Rolls Royces and Bentleys, and an impulse buyer finds one of the cars a new home.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Three rare Alvises get the auction buyers going when put under the hammer. A Chevy Corvette which started its journey in Saudi Arabia makes its way to Thornton le Dale for the sale.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Dave gets a nasty surprise when he opens the bonnet of a fast Ford from the 80's, and an Austin Heavy 12 nearly a century old sets off a bidding war at the auction.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek, with help from the Mathewson clan, drag a mini pickup out of the barn where it's been for 20 years, and a 350cc Douglas Mark V motorbike from 1950 goes under the hammer.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Four VW camper vans pitch up at the auction house looking for a new home and Derek picks up an Austin 16 that 'goes like stink and has some unusual modern modifications'.

programme.title: Saluting Dad's Army
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong celebrates the genius and impact of enduring classic BBC sitcom Dad's Army paying tribute to those who created it. From the very first conversation and the true stories that inspired the series, through to its long-standing legacy, he revisits the entire history of the seminal sitcom. Using archive footage and newly captured interviews, the series offers a true insight into how Dad's Army became not just a TV hit, but an institution.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Michelle takes advantage of the fact that the Germans think Rene is dead, planning for him to go to England to help the British win the war.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: As Michelle makes arrangements to send a microfilm to England by homing pigeon, Herr Flick captures Yvette and Mimi in order to gain access to the cafe to search for the painting of the Fallen Madonna. However, the town's annual Fishmongers' Parade proves a hindrance for all concerned. Gordon Kaye and Kirsten Cooke star.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Rene and the others make the final preparations for the parade, while the general, the colonel and Gruber play a round of golf, during which they discuss the plot to blow up Hitler.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of a North Yorkshire-based, family-run historic car auction business, which uncovers some remarkably rare vehicles in the picturesque village of Thornton-le-Dale.

programme.title: History Hunters
programme.desc: The team acquire a personalised Victorian pistol and try to track down the original owner. A customer brings in brasses that his dad brought back from the Somme.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The untold secret story of war production that shaped the Second World War, beginning with how the German aviation industry came to dominate the skies of Europe.

The first volume, published in 1933, reinforced the perception of him as a man past his time. But it was the second instalment, depicting John Churchill's march to the Danube and victory at Blenheim, which began to mark out Winston as the only leading politician who truly knew war.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Churchills
programme.desc: Historian David Starkey describes how Winston Churchill drew on the lessons of his ancestor John to lead the UK through the Second World War. At two key moments, the prime minister's strategic sense helped avert disaster, and in both decisions, the influence of the Duke of Marlborough is apparent. Starkey argues that it was Winston's ability to control events by giving them a narrative meaning that enabled him to shape world history long after his fall from power.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on an expedition along Dorset's Jurassic coast to explore the county's hidden Second World War story. Starting beside the defences on Chesil Beach, he heads east to finish in Swanage and Studland Bay. On his five-day walk he encounters stunning scenery and uncovers wartime acts of ingenuity and bravery. He also discovers the crucial part a swannery played in developing a secret weapon and reveals the role of Dorset in protecting Britain from invasion during the conflict.

programme.title: Royal Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: The mysterious death of the Duke of Kent in a 1942 plane crash, which has led to accusations of the Royal family erasing him from history.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: The story of Major General Roy Urquhart, who successfully evaded the enemy in his retreat across the Rhine after leading British troops into a doomed attack at Arnhem.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Laurence Olivier narrates this documentary chronicling events leading up to the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbour on December 7, 1941, and the subsequent collapse of unprepared British forces before the advancing enemy in Singapore. Includes interviews with veterans from both sides.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A village ruin that is now pitted and scarred, a ghostly fleet of ships, a bridge to nowhere hidden in a forest and strange metal structures in a wood.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines animals that are able to expand their bodies, including anacondas and camels.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough reveals the unusual ways in which flamingoes and blue whales eat, examining the ways feeding patterns have influenced both species' behaviour in similar ways.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris takes a railway trip across Canada, revealing how 2,500 miles of transcontinental railway was built against huge odds in just a few decades, helping to join together a vast wilderness of isolated communities and create the country that exists today. He begins his journey on one of the earliest sections of track to be built, on a train that is now a lifeline for hunters and fishermen. He then sees one of the biggest, most famous trains in the world - the Canadian, before heading for the Prairies, and on to the port of Vancouver. Along the way he also searches for Winnie the Pooh, crosses raging rivers and meets the descendant of a pioneering Yorkshire family who arrived here more than 100 years ago.

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: With the arrival of autumn the Arctic Ocean begins freezing over, and polar bears gather in large numbers on the coast as they await the return of the ice. Two thousand beluga whales head for a particular estuary to thrash against the gravel and exfoliate, while in Antarctica, Adelie penguins take to the sea for the first time and face the danger of leopard seal attacks.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of wild animals that have made a home in cities, including leopards on the streets of Mumbai, peregrine falcons hunting among New York's skyscrapers, hyenas that live peacefully alongside the people of Harar, macaques in Jaipur, and langurs in Jodhpur, which are regarded as having great religious significance by the citizens. The programme also examines how some animals are struggling to survive in urban environments, and questions how cities can be built to serve their needs as well as those of the human inhabitants.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Constructing the Gotthard Base Tunnel in Switzerland, the longest rail tunnel in the world, running for 57 kilometres through the Alps.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: The story of Lieutenant General Leslie Morshead, who commanded the British and Australian troops who held off Rommel's Afrika Korps at the port of Tobruk in 1941.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Factors influencing America's decision to support Britain during the Second World War, and how Hitler's declaration of war on the US convinced Congress to take more decisive action. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An abandoned prison beneath the water, a tunnel in the heart of a mountain, concrete towers hidden in the woods and a rusting coastal relic.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Kevin Norris and Kieran Chisnall move three state-of-the-art trains, fresh in from Japan. They need to transport them from the North East port of Redcar to a factory in Doncaster.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: The team is under pressure with a record number of cars to auction, but Derek finds room for one more - a replica AC Cobra. A couple are reunited with their Volvo breakdown truck.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A Cold War Soviet classic goes under the hammer. Built like a tank, the Moskovitch gets few admirers for style, but finds a loving home with a fan of Eastern Bloc classics.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright is reluctant to buy a new suit until Nurse Gladys Emmanuel persuades him to. He agrees, but only if I can be made in the same style as his old one. Roy Clarke's classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker, David Jason and Lynda Baron.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright expands his empire by opening a mobile shop in a bid to impress Nurse Gladys Emmanuel, but the enterprise is cut short by a close encounter with some perishables.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson sets off on a 45-mile hike through the countryside of the Weald in Kent and the Downs of East Sussex to discover the area's rich and surprising Tudor heritage. At Penshurst Place, author Philippa Gregory helps him relish the fate of the Grand Duke of Buckingham at the hands of the young Henry VIII. From there, he travels up what used to be secret paths to Hever Castle and finds out how the monarch's reign brought not only huge social, political and industrial change, but also fame and disaster to the women who caught his eye He ends this leg of his journey in Lewes, where he relives one of the more brutal monastic dissolutions.

programme.title: Royal Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: The crime documentary continues, shedding light on rumours that Princess Anastasia, daughter of Tsar Nicholas II, managed to escape death at the hands of the Bolsheviks in 1918.

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: The presenter examines the social significance of cars in the 20th century. He begins by travelling to Germany, Italy and Russia to examine how dictators kick-started the mobilization of the masses, finding tales of design brilliance, abject failure, war, fraud and double dealing. James also learns about how the British motor industry blew a gift-wrapped chance to rule the world and he gets his own back with a stunt that means bad news for one of the planet's most hated cars.

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines how the arrival of winter sparks a ruthless battle for survival in the polar regions, with temperatures plummeting to -70C, winds reaching 120mph and day-long darkness. As a blizzard rages, a polar bear treks into the Arctic mountains to give birth, while the entire world population of spectacled eider braves the weather in a giant ice hole. Wolves and bison engage in battle, but alliances are also made, and beneath the snow, voles try to dodge the attacks of great grey owls and weasels.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough presents an exploration of Earth's vast seas, which cover 70 per cent of the planet's surface. programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson goes on a four-day trek through the Kintail region of the north-western Highlands, examining the story of the Jacobite uprisings of the early 1700s along the way. He starts by visiting Iron Age dwellings in Shiel Bridge, and heads to the rebuilt castle on Eilean Donan, the original of which was destroyed after invading Spanish troops landed there and were attacked by British warships. Tony ends in Glen Shiel, the site of a climactic battle in 1719 where royalist troops defeated the rebels.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on a 45-mile walk across Wiltshire, from Avebury to Stonehenge, telling the story of the remarkable development that occurred in the latter days of the Neolithic era. His route over chalk downlands and Salisbury Plain takes him through one of the greatest concentrations of prehistoric sites in Europe.

programme.desc: The presenter continues his examination of how the car became an everyday part of people's lives, exploring the weird world of small vehicles. programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the life and work of people in the polar regions, including the residents of Norilsk in Siberia, the coldest city on Earth. programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: It was 30 years after the Romans invaded Britain that they were ready to take on the challenge of conquering the Lake District. With the toughest landscape they had encountered in the nation, peopled by a rebellious tribe, it was no small task, but within a few years, the whole of Lakeland was under their control. Tony Robinson tackles the journey by himself, walking 50 miles from Penrith to Ambleside and on to the Irish Sea at Ravenglass, discovering that the Romans encountered beauty and danger in equal measure.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson takes a four-day trek along the coastline between Plymouth in Devon and Falmouth, learning about the thriving smuggling trade in Cornwall during the late 18th century. The area's tiny secretive harbours, beaches and secluded coves were ideal for illicit imports such as tobacco and brandy, and the business was so huge it threatened the national economy. Along his route, visiting such beauty spots as Lantic Bay and Polperro, he encounters all sorts of reminders of the trade and meets descendants of those involved.

programme.title: Royal Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: Calls to reinvestigate the suspicious death of King Ludwig of Bavaria in 1886, who died three days after he was declared insane and deposed from the throne.

programme.desc: The creation of a set of Second World War sea defences built near the mouth of the River Thames to protect London. Plus, a concrete pyramid build during the Cold War.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Camera crews journey to the deepest parts of the world's oceans to explore the lives of their inhabitants, including fearsome predators with huge teeth, strange jellyfish and deep-sea sharks that lurk among the gigantic submerged mountains and volcanos. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: James concludes his examination of the social significance of cars by exploring how aspiration and new wealth were behind the development of some of the greatest models ever made. He tries to make sense of the baffling world of company car hierarchy by holding a travelling salesman race-off and indulges his 1980s urges with the twin delights of a Lamborghini and a Porsche. He also unveils his choice of the ultimate people's car - a vehicle that can lay claim to being the greatest in history.

programme.title: Madagascar
programme.desc: David Attenborough narrates the story of the island in the Indian Ocean, off the southeastern coast of Africa. It has an ecosystem that has stood in isolation for millions of years, and produced an array of wildlife that cannot be found anywhere else on the planet. He begins by observing lemurs in their habitat, male red giraffe-necked weevils fighting each other, the courting rituals of chameleons, and the behaviour of spiders and fossas.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Predators and prey in the open oceans come under the scrutiny of David Attenborough. Marlin track down a shoal of sardines as a sei whale scoops up the leftovers, dolphins herd mackerel and attract the attention of a sailfish with the resonance of their sonar, and giant sunfish queue up to allow other species, including seagulls, to feed on their parasites.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The Millau Viaduct in South West France, which is the tallest bridge in the world and stretches two and a half kilometres over one of Europe's deepest valleys.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: A profile of Dudley Mason, who was awarded the George Cross after the tanker he was commanding came under attack during Operation Pedestal in August 1942 to relieve Malta.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How German U-boats were used to disrupt the flow of goods from America across the Atlantic Ocean in an attempt to starve Britain into submission.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A devastated cliff-top ruin, an extraordinarily tall tower, a concrete structure stranded at sea and a heavy metal monster in a field all feature.

programme.title: The Story of Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: The making of the sitcom, featuring a look back at how Del's distinctive look was created and rare footage of a special sketch performed by the cast for the royal family.

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: Edmund receives a visit from the bloodthirsty Bishop of Bath and Wells, who threatens to do him a mischief with a red-hot poker over the matter of an unpaid loan. As he attempts to raise the 1,000 he needs, he finds himself being constantly summoned to the court by the Queen. Comedy, starring Rowan Atkinson and Miranda Richardson.

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: Lord Melchett challenges Edmund to a drinking contest that he cannot get out of - but his puritanical uncle and aunt Lord and Lady Whiteadder are visiting on the same night, leaving him trying to be in two places at once. Comedy, guest starring Miriam Margolyes, with Rowan Atkinson and Stephen Fry.

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: Edmund and Lord Melchett are embarrassingly kidnapped by a maniacal German master of disguise with designs on the English throne. Unfortunately for them, the Queen decides to pay only one of the ransom demands. Comedy, guest starring Hugh Laurie, with Rowan Atkinson and Stephen Fry.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The construction of the Vajont Dam in the mountains of northern Italy, and the catastrophic flood in 1963 that caused the deaths of 2000 people.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The Millau Viaduct in South West France, which is the tallest bridge in the world and stretches two and a half kilometres over one of Europe's deepest valleys.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How German U-boats were used to disrupt the flow of goods from America across the Atlantic Ocean in an attempt to starve Britain into submission.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: It was 30 years after the Romans invaded Britain that they were ready to take on the challenge of conquering the Lake District. With the toughest landscape they had encountered in the nation, peopled by a rebellious tribe, it was no small task, but within a few years, the whole of Lakeland was under their control. Tony Robinson tackles the journey by himself, walking 50 miles from Penrith to Ambleside and on to the Irish Sea at Ravenglass, discovering that the Romans encountered beauty and danger in equal measure.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on another expedition through some of Britain's most historic landscapes. He begins with a towpath exploration of industrial engineering along the Leeds and Liverpool Canal. Setting off from Liverpool, he takes a three-day walk inland to Wigan, ending at the town's iconic pier as he traces the story of the waterway's chaotic construction and its impact on the development of Lancashire.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson explores the history of the ancient kingdom on a walk from Melrose in the Scottish Borders to Holy Island off the coast of Northumberland. Over five days, he goes on the trail of one of Northumbria's greatest sons - Saint Cuthbert. Through the Tweed Valley and across the Cheviot Hills, it's a journey through a murky history laden with myth. However, by investigating the communities, power bases and landscape of seventh-century Northumbria, Tony aims to understand the pagan land in which Cuthbert spread his simple brand of Celtic Christianity.

programme.title: Royal Murder Mysteries
programme.sub-title: Albert Victor: The Prince and the Ripper
programme.desc: Sordid speculation dogged the life of Prince Albert Victor, who was even a suspect in the Jack the Ripper case.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: A profile of Dudley Mason, who was awarded the George Cross after the tanker he was commanding came under attack during Operation Pedestal in August 1942 to relieve Malta.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How German U-boats were used to disrupt the flow of goods from America across the Atlantic Ocean in an attempt to starve Britain into submission.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The construction of the Vajont Dam in the mountains of northern Italy, and the catastrophic flood in 1963 that caused the deaths of 2000 people.

programme.title: The Blue Planet

Marlin track down a shoal of sardines as a sei whale scoops up the leftovers, dolphins herd mackerel and attract the attention of a sailfish with the resonance of their sonar, and giant sunfish queue up to allow other species, including seagulls, to feed on their parasites.

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: The presenter examines how the car industry in Germany and Japan blossomed following the Second World War, becoming manufacturing giants that far outstripped the Allied nations that had defeated them. He test drives some of the vehicles Germany and Japan produced during the post-war period, as well as an assortment of other classic cars, including E-Types and Mustangs. He also reveals the sad tale of the Austin Allegro, a vehicle that had a devastating impact on the British car industry.

programme.title: Madagascar
programme.desc: An observation of the wildlife that inhabits the narrow band of mountains and rainforest on the island's east coast, from ring-tailed lemurs living on an inhospitable peak, to forest-dwelling sifakas, small primates on the verge of extinction. The programme also focuses on the golden bamboo lemur, which is capable of consuming daily doses of cyanide, and looks at the fruit-rich treetops where red-ruffed lemurs defend their food and territory. Narrated by David Attenborough.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Marine life at the poles, where winter temperatures frequently fall to a numbing -40C. Even when the sun reappears in the spring, its weak rays take a long time to melt the ice. David Attenborough describes how wildlife including seals, whales, polar bears and penguins overcome the elements to survive through prolonged cold spells.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A colossal American football stadium in Texas, that features the world's largest retractable roof and is able to seat over 100,000 spectators with no restricted viewpoints.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: An examination of how Leon Degrelle and an array of Finns, Estonians and fellow Belgians joined German volunteer brigades to hold off the Red Army on the Eastern front during the Second World War and enabled 56,000 men to escape.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Account of Operation Barbarossa, Germany's plan to invade the Soviet Union in 1941, revealing the massive human and financial cost endured by the Soviet people, who fought a bloody and lonely war with little support from the Allies. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Hidden tunnels that saw a city prosper, a sunken wreck with a remarkable past, a concrete wartime dome and a mysterious Cold War building.

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
programme.desc: This edition examines the efforts of the British and Canadians who fought elite German divisions to capture the city of Caen, the key to breaking out of Normandy.

programme.title: Holocaust Escape Tunnel
programme.desc: Archaeologists search for a rumoured escape route from a Nazi execution site in Poland that led to a nearby Synagogue, which was later destroyed by the Soviet army.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A ruined compound on the edge of a peninsula in Colombia which was once home to a famous outlaw and the strange towers looming over red-tinted waters in a Portuguese landscape.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The stories behind an abandoned Second World War aviation facility in Farnborough, a Soviet airbase in the Gobi Desert, and a disused furnace in Pittsburgh.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A colossal American football stadium in Texas, that features the world's largest retractable roof and is able to seat over 100,000 spectators with no restricted viewpoints.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Account of Operation Barbarossa, Germany's plan to invade the Soviet Union in 1941, revealing the massive human and financial cost endured by the Soviet people, who fought a bloody and lonely war with little support from the Allies. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

He begins with a towpath exploration of industrial engineering along the Leeds and Liverpool Canal. Setting off from Liverpool, he takes a three-day walk inland to Wigan, ending at the town's iconic pier as he traces the story of the waterway's chaotic construction and its impact on the development of Lancashire.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson travels along the north Norfolk coast through one of the least developed spots in Britain, finding out how the area maintained its rural, remote identity despite the dynamic industrial changes of the Victorian age. From the arrival of Bertie, Prince of Wales at Sandringham House to the opening of Cromer Pier, Tony's four-day walk sees him learn about key periods in the county's history. He explores prime shooting estates, purpose-built seaside resorts, salt marshes and disused railway lines as he discovers how powerful landowners were able to control development and even shape the railways to suit their needs.

programme.title: The First Silent Night
programme.desc: Simon Callow discovers the origin of the Christmas carol and the story of the two Austrians who wrote it.

programme.title: Nazi Murder Mysteries
programme.sub-title: Who Put Bella in the Wych Elm
programme.desc: The dark tale of the skeleton of an unknown woman found in a hollowed-out tree in Birmingham woodland, exploring the links between the woman and Nazi spy rings operating in Britain.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Zak and Alex face a four-day mission to deliver a pair of classic steam locomotives for an Autumn Steam Gala at the Mid Hants Railway in Hampshire.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek collects a Jaguar Mark 2 and explains why they made such poor getaway cars for 1960s bank robbers. A customer considers a Morris Marina as a Christmas present for his wife.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: The team is under pressure with a record number of cars to auction, but Derek finds room for one more - a replica AC Cobra. A couple are reunited with their Volvo breakdown truck.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A classic car fan with a love of the Jaguar E-Type reluctantly sends his dream car to auction, hoping to buy a motorhome with the money. Two Ford Escorts get Dave's pulse racing.

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: An exploration of the effects of the eruption of volcanos in the ocean. From these violent beginnings emerge islands and coral reefs that are home to a vast array of wildlife, including giant manta rays and vampire bugs that thrive in the tropical snow, after a process that takes millions of years. Benedict Cumberbatch narrates.

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: The struggle for survival on the region's isolated islands, home to flightless parrots, burrowing bats, giant skinks and tree-dwelling kangaroos. The documentary reveals how the arrival of new species can upset the delicate natural balance, with disastrous consequences, and explores the human history of the region. Benedict Cumberbatch narrates.

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: Efforts to preserve the marine life of the region, which is home to the world's richest coral reefs and an array of species, including whales, sharks, albatross and tuna. Despite millions of people relying on its fish stocks, the seas have very little protection and face various threats, with international fishing fleets taking a disastrous toll. Benedict Cumberbatch narrates.

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: An exploration of the effects of the eruption of volcanos in the ocean. From these violent beginnings emerge islands and coral reefs that are home to a vast array of wildlife, including giant manta rays and vampire bugs that thrive in the tropical snow, after a process that takes millions of years. Benedict Cumberbatch narrates.

programme.title: TOTP2
programme.desc: Another selection of performances from the archive, focusing on hits of the 1960s. The programme features Lulu, the Kinks, the Walker Brothers and Don Partridge.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: Recalling a decade in British music, with archive performances from the early stages of the 'swingin' era, featuring music by by rock, pop and R'n'B artists including the Springfields, the Shadows, the Beatles and the Rolling Stones.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: More pop, rock and rhythm and blues from the archives, featuring appearances by the Rolling Stones, the Dave Clark Five, the Seekers and the Byrds from 1964 and '65.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: A selection of archive footage from the arrival of the so-called beat boom in 1964, which catered to the art-school craze for rhythm and blues. Featuring performances by Tom Jones, the Kinks, Manfred Mann, the Rolling Stones, John Lee Hooker and the Pretty Things.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris takes a railway trip across Canada, revealing how 2,500 miles of transcontinental railway was built against huge odds in just a few decades, helping to join together a vast wilderness of isolated communities and create the country that exists today. He begins his journey on one of the earliest sections of track to be built, on a train that is now a lifeline for hunters and fishermen. He then sees one of the biggest, most famous trains in the world - the Canadian, before heading for the Prairies, and on to the port of Vancouver. Along the way he also searches for Winnie the Pooh, crosses raging rivers and meets the descendant of a pioneering Yorkshire family who arrived here more than 100 years ago.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A formerly luxurious and strategic mountain-top villa on the island of Rhodes in the Mediterranean that's been ravaged by acts of revenge by locals since 1955.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Kevin Norris and Kieran Chisnall move three state-of-the-art trains, fresh in from Japan. They need to transport them from the North East port of Redcar to a factory in Doncaster.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Stratolaunch is designed to lift rockets, spacecraft and experimental high-speed hypersonic planes into the stratosphere, then release them for their onward journey into space.

programme.title: The First Silent Night
programme.desc: Simon Callow discovers the origin of the Christmas carol and the story of the two Austrians who wrote it.

He explores prime shooting estates, purpose-built seaside resorts, salt marshes and disused railway lines as he discovers how powerful landowners were able to control development and even shape the railways to suit their needs.

programme.title: Trial & Retribution
programme.desc: Fifteen-year-old Cassie Booth goes missing while doing her local paper round, and her blood-stained clothes are later found in a nearby boathouse owned by Karl Wilding. He is the prime suspect, but then seemingly helpful Stephen Warrington, a wine merchant who has initially brought a complaint about a house being used as a brothel, demonstrates too much interest in the case.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the stunning Rowden Gardens on Dartmoor - one of the participants in the National Gardens Scheme.

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: One Step Too Far - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. Laura looks at Gabriel with new eyes when he takes a surprisingly compassionate approach to her wayward son Liam, who is being bullied because of her job. Adam tries to mend fences with the rank-and-file officers by going out on the beat with June - only to lose his cool completely when a traffic accident triggers painful memories. Samantha jeopardises Jo's investigation by poaching her informant, leading to a bitter row, while Gary's future on the force looks uncertain after he reacts to Suzie's constant needling with a very public outburst.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: One Step Too Far - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. Laura begins to feel increasingly unfulfilled in her role as PCSO, and announces to Smithy that she wants to become a PC. Gina's old flame Jonathan Fox returns to Sun Hill, and Neil pressures Gary to drop his bullying accusations against Susie Sim. Gabriel warns an increasingly infatuated Sheelagh not to get involved with him, while Samantha continues to needle Jo, fuelling an already volatile situation.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Zain Nadir searches for a missing 14-year-old whose online romance has led her into danger, and a guilt-stricken Gabriel reveals to Sheelagh that he deliberately killed the Sun Hill sniper by pushing him from a rooftop. Meanwhile, Honey returns to work after the shock suicide of murderous husband Scott, and finds herself paired with arch-enemy Amber Johannsen. True to form, it isn't long before they come to blows.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Zain Nadir discovers Smithy has been canoodling with the wife of notorious local gangster Pete Larson, while arch-rivals Amber and Honey are teamed up yet again, this time to catch a gang defrauding cash machines. June has another bash at warning Sheelagh against getting too involved with Gabriel, and Phil is livid to discover ex-lover Christine is planning on emigrating to Australia - taking their daughter Madison with her.

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Detective Inspector Henry Crabbe prepares for his retirement and the opening of his restaurant - but the police force seems reluctant to let him go. First episode of the crime drama, starring Richard Griffiths and Maggie Steed.

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Henry is enlisted in the search for a missing policeman, but the restaurant's opening night is looming. Detective drama, starring Richard Griffiths and Maggie Steed.

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: Andrew Davies' adaptation of Jane Austen's classic novel, starring Colin Firth, Jennifer Ehle, Alison Steadman, Benjamin Whitrow and Julia Sawalha. A wealthy eligible bachelor rents a property in Hertfordshire, causing a flurry of anticipation among the ladies of the district. However, it transpires he also brought along a friend - the haughty and aloof Fitzwilliam Darcy.

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: Mrs Bennet spots an opportunity to marry off another of her daughters with the arrival of clergyman Mr Collins. However, Elizabeth is unable to take his proposal seriously, being too preoccupied with a handsome newcomer who poisons her mind further against Mr Darcy. Alison Steadman, Jennifer Ehle and David Bamber star in Andrew Davies' adaptation of Jane Austen's classic novel.

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: Elizabeth visits Mr Collins once Charlotte has accepted his proposal of marriage and confides in Jane that she regards him as one of the stupidest men in England. Mrs Bennet sizes up George Wickham as a potential suitor for her daughter - but he has set his heart on society heiress Miss King.

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: Rejected by Elizabeth, Darcy decides to return to Rosling Park - and resolves to reveal the truth about Wickham's character in a letter. Colin Firth, Jennifer Ehle, Alison Steadman, Benjamin Whitrow and Julia Sawalha star.

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: Despite Miss Bingley's efforts to keep them apart, Darcy and Elizabeth's relationship grows more affectionate - until bad news arrives from Longbourn about Lydia and Wickham. Jane Austen adaptation, starring Jennifer Ehle, Colin Firth and Julia Sawalha.

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: Wickham's elopement with Lydia makes Elizabeth see him for what he really is, while Bingley proposes to Jane - an offer she readily accepts. Colin Firth and Jennifer Ehle star.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The nuns and midwives return home after their trip to South Africa, to find Nonnatus House has come under new management. The formidable Sister Ursula (Harriet Walter) has taken charge and introduced some drastic changes to the way the clinic is run, which Sister Julienne, bound by her vow of obedience, is powerless to oppose. The midwives come to the aid of a victim of domestic violence whose husband is about to be released from prison, and who risks losing everything if she seeks a divorce. Sister Mary Cynthia suffers further anxiety attacks, and Patsy receives distressing news about her father.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: The owner and curator of Brokenwood's Historic Village, Charity Highmore-Browne, dies after being struck by an arrow. Mike and his team delve into the realm of New Zealand's colonial past as they deal with suspects including a blacksmith, a missionary, the local postmaster and the victim's sister. Neill Rea stars.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Two long-dead bodies are found in a disused coal mine on the outskirts of Glasgow when it is reopened to serve as the central attraction for a museum. Investigations reveal the pair had been involved in violent encounters just before their deaths, and the search to discover their identities uncovers deeply buried resentments in the community. Detective drama, starring Alex Norton, Blythe Duff and John Michie.

programme.title: Trial & Retribution
programme.desc: Pat is forced to deal with a persistent complainer who has been hounding the station, and becomes concerned when he starts stalking her. Eventually Pat is abducted by Warrington and forced to discover Cassie North's corpse. Drama, starring Kate Buffery and Richard E Grant.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The dealer recruits con artists Matron Jackie, Gideon and Henry the Hearse Chaser to attend an auction where he is selling a painting, to purposely bid against each other to bump up the price. However, Lady Jane also bids and after discovering the ruse concocts a plan to get her own back and wipe the smile off Lovejoy's face. Charlotte Cornwell guest stars with Ian McShane and Phyllis Logan.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the inspirational Bluebell Cottage in Cheshire, which is open to the public as part of the National Gardens Scheme project.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Sarah performs a spiritual cleansing in the local creek as a religious occasion approaches, but she's spotted by Doris Collins. She finds it hard to deal with the woman's reaction to her nudity, but it is her own personal demons that she is struggling with the most. Marta Dusseldorp and Deborah Kennedy star.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Anna and Gino's romance continues to blossom as they sneak off to spend time together - even though it's clear that something about their secret trysts is playing on Gino's mind. Meanwhile, at Ash Park, Olivia and James's relationship is at breaking point as Olivia struggles with the identity of James's lover. Romantic drama, starring Marta Dusseldorp.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Terry appears in court to testify against brother Ben, but reacts badly to being questioned about his own childhood abuse, indirectly jeopardising the outcome of the trial. Phil begins to realise he is powerless to stop former lover Christine emigrating with their daughter Madison, while Smithy spends the night with sultry Louise Larson, unaware Zain Nadir is investigating the criminal activities of her husband Pete.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Connie is devastated when her patient collapses and there is not enough time to arrange a heart transplant. Nick tries to get Diane on his side by letting her perform a difficult procedure for the first time, while Ric talks her into taking the research position full time. Kyla brings Max to work as he is a diabetic and she is worried about his blood sugar levels.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: The atmosphere is tense between new nurse Barney Wolfe and Adam as they fail to see eye to eye. Two serious cases of food poisoning panic one unfortunate fellow, who rushes home to check on his son, only to discover that his wife is having an affair, and Duffy begins to feel the pressures of her new responsibilities. Derek Thompson, Cathy Shipton and Ian Bleasdale star.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Anita Dobson guests as Phil Hunter's mum Lynne, who turns up at the station to lecture him on his responsibilities as a father-to-be. Smithy seizes an opportunity to meet local villain's wife Louise Larson and continue their dangerous relationship, while Adam struggles to make headway with his road safety campaign, until old friend Isaac Collins pulls a few strings at the local council to help get it under way. In court, the case against Terry's brother Ben concludes - but the outcome promises to have a devastating long-term effect on the entire family.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Shelley's ready to be more than friends with Mark. Pauline's determined to find out about Pete's disappearance. Gita warns Cindy about Richard.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Richard continues to pursue Cindy, meanwhile Pauline has concerns about Arthur.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A man climbs a chimney in protest against the Thames Relief Road, but the rescue escalates into a serious operation.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Archie begins coaching the Glenbogle five-a-side team for their big match against Glencampbell, but reluctantly hands over the reins to his brother Paul to allow him to concentrate on important estate business. Molly attempts to avoid a weekend trip with Andrew, fearing she is not ready for a new romance, and Golly is reunited with his estranged daughter Jess.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: The nurses get more than they bargained for as they prepare for a darts match in the Skelthwaite Arms, and Beth has a surprise visitor. Drama, starring Lesley Dunlop and Leslie Ash.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: The Boswell family try to cope without Nellie, who has some surprise visitors - her 'fancy man' Derek and Lilo Lill.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: It is a day of discontent at Maplin's when the pay packets arrive, and Ted and Spike act out the French Revolution in the swimming pool. Comedy, starring Paul Shane, David Griffin and Ruth Madoc.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean and Lionel settle down to enjoy a quiet evening, only to find themselves constantly disturbed by ominous noises from the empty house next door. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo gets out his old motorbike and tries to perform a few stunts - much to the surprise of Blamire and Clegg. Bill Owen, Michael Bates and Peter Sallis star.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The detective duo are called to a hospital, where a series of suspicious deaths has raised fears a serial killer may be at work on the wards. A grisly collection of body parts is found in a nearby lake, and both patients and staff are dropping dead with alarming regularity. However, Pascoe soon finds his own health is as much of a worry as the case itself. Robert Powell, Miriam Karlin and Haydn Gwynne guest star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Fresh DNA tests on an unidentified body found in 1996 reveal a family link to a Home Office fingerprint analyst, who has not seen her brother since she was seven, when he brought her over to the UK from their home country of Albania. The victim had been working as a police interpreter - and the motive seems clear when it turns out his last assignment was translating for a witness in a murder trial against a notorious Albanian criminal. Meanwhile, Gerry embarks on a French cookery course, but the language barrier results in a rather surprising date. Amanda Redman and Dennis Waterman star.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Eve links DNA evidence found at a traffic collision to a murder case she worked on while examining mass graves during the Balkan War, leaving Boyd determined to track down the perpetrators, a ring of war criminals now living and working in the UK. Starring Trevor Eve and Sue Johnston, with guest stars Ron Cook, Anna Madeley and Branka Katic.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Anita Dobson guests as Phil Hunter's mum Lynne, who turns up at the station to lecture him on his responsibilities as a father-to-be. Smithy seizes an opportunity to meet local villain's wife Louise Larson and continue their dangerous relationship, while Adam struggles to make headway with his road safety campaign, until old friend Isaac Collins pulls a few strings at the local council to help get it under way. In court, the case against Terry's brother Ben concludes - but the outcome promises to have a devastating long-term effect on the entire family.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A man climbs a chimney in protest against the Thames Relief Road, but the rescue escalates into a serious operation.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward explores the historic city of Warwick as part of her National Gardens Scheme tour, discovering medieval buildings and the gardens of Lord Leycester Hospital.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Sarah heads to Sydney with George and Anna to see her ill mother, while Elizabeth decides to reveal her darkest secret in the hope that it will save James and Olivia's marriage. Elsewhere, Sir Henry Swanson makes a request to receive a Japanese trade delegation at Ash Park.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Elizabeth is rushed to hospital after suffering a heart attack, and is looked after tenderly by Jack, but comes close to revealing a secret from her past while heavily sedated. Her frail health makes Anna and Gino decide to postpone telling their families about their relationship, but Carla becomes suspicious after finding contraception hidden in Anna's room.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Anita Dobson guests as Phil Hunter's mum Lynne, who turns up at the station to lecture him on his responsibilities as a father-to-be. Smithy seizes an opportunity to meet local villain's wife Louise Larson and continue their dangerous relationship, while Adam struggles to make headway with his road safety campaign, until old friend Isaac Collins pulls a few strings at the local council to help get it under way. In court, the case against Terry's brother Ben concludes - but the outcome promises to have a devastating long-term effect on the entire family.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Elliot fears for his wife, who has motor neurone disease and whose health appears to be getting worse. He also regrets their decision to keep her condition a secret from Martha - not realising she knows something is up and has persuaded Joseph to help her learn the truth. Sam uncovers a family secret when he treats a boy who is undergoing a heart transplant.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Sean asks Max to put in a good word for him with Tina, but the result is totally unexpected. Holly befriends a little boy caught in the crossfire of marital breakdown, and a pensioner with a fractured neck sparks recriminations between her husband and son. Gerald Kyd and Claire Goose star.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: A Small Price to Pay - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of three. Gina returns to her job immediately after receiving treatment for her cancer. Clearly unfit for work but too stubborn to admit it, she relies on June to oversee the relief. Gary is shot during a raid on a gang suspected of handling stolen goods, while Phil bristles with righteous indignation at the discovery that Kate has been mugged at knifepoint and vows to catch the thug responsible. As for Adam, he hits another snag as he tries to get his road safety initiative up and running, and again asks Isaac Collins to help - unaware his old friend's shady past is about to catch up with him.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Cindy is going to the restaurant with Richard. Kath is fed up with Arthur and Mrs Hewitt. Dot visits her grandson. Gita tells her sister she has to go.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Cindy confesses to Ian that she has been out with Richard. Dot visits her grandson Ashley.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The Blue Watch boys tackle two different, but equally dangerous and challenging blazes, one at a car-breaker's yard, the other in a Chinese restaurant.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Dorothy announces her plans to build an eco-dome, but Lexie is suspicious of her motives - and when it is revealed the proposed access road runs through the newly established outdoor activity centre, relations break down between Paul and Archie. Meanwhile, Duncan relishes his new job but discovers Hermione has lied to him, and Jess accuses Golly of being sexist when she fails to get the head ranger's job.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: David puts his money worries aside to captain the local cricket team in a grudge match against their rivals _ but is the game up for the bungling businessman? Hussan uses a cheap trick to try to win Jess back, while Anna refuses to let Simon help her with the baby, determined to go it alone, but finds comfort in sharing her woes with young mum Marie Briggs, who is also struggling to cope with the pressures of single parenthood. Small-town drama, starring Lesley Dunlop and Philip Middlemiss.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Nellie, newly released from hospital, meets the family at the Victorian mansion for their holiday - but things aren't exactly relaxing.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Gladys agrees to marry Clive - much to his family's dismay. Comedy, starring Ruth Madoc.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean begins to think that, 19 months after tying the knot, her marriage may have become stale. She wonders whether a few surprises from Lionel would spice things up, so Alistair, helped by Judith and Sandy, comes up with a plan to give her the treat of a lifetime.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Cyril Blamire leaves to live in Oswestry, after hearing a lady he is interested in has become a widow. However, his old friend Foggy Dewhurst arrives in the village, and soon makes his presence known to the locals. Brian Wilde stars.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: The judge hears the case of three men accused of shooting a rival gang member - but the trial is in danger of collapsing when the prosecution's main witness is killed in a hit-and-run incident. To make matters worse, the jurors start to fall sick, and the newly appointed Home Secretary sees a chance to make it into a jury-less trial - which could force Deed to throw it out altogether. Martin Shaw stars, with Jenny Seagrove.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: New information links the unexplained death of a market trader to a series of drug rapes in east London - but with that case still ongoing, Ucos officers are unable to question the chief suspect, so they have to look into their victim's past in their search for clues. Gerry finds a likely culprit in the shape of the market inspector who clamped his car, while Sandra has problems of a more personal nature when her hated mother arrives for a visit. Sheila Hancock guest stars.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. After a naked woman is found fleeing a car accident, she is taken to hospital and tests reveal her DNA is linked to a double murder in 1960s Soho. Boyd discovers the victim, successful entrepreneur Elizabeth Andrews, has suffered a horrific attack at the hands of her abductors and he is led to her home, where a man presumed to be her husband is found hanged in the hallway. With a new murder as well as the cold case to solve, the team tries to connect the crimes, but a greater danger awaits Elizabeth in hospital. Drama, starring Trevor Eve and his real-life wife Sharon Maughan.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Sarah and George begin a secret affair and meet at the cottage. However, Anna hopes that if she can push her father towards Sarah that he will be more open to learning about her relationship with Gino, but she is frustrated over the arrival of her aunt Regina. Meanwhile, James struggles with his emotions. Romantic drama, starring Marta Dusseldorp.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: George is asked to host a Japanese trade delegation on the eve of Remembrance Day. Knowing how the community will react, he asks Jack to come to the reception in the hope that the approval of a former Japanese prisoner of war might help deal with any ill feeling. At the event Regina is openly hostile toward Sarah, which she attributes to anti-Semitism. Anna's prolonged absence from Ash Park has Gino fearing that their relationship is over, but he is unaware that she is with Caroline awaiting the results of a pregnancy test. Meanwhile, James and Olivia continue to grow closer. Romantic drama, starring Marta Dusseldorp.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: A Small Price to Pay - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of three. Gina returns to her job immediately after receiving treatment for her cancer. programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: The tension between Ric and Nick reaches crisis point during a bowel transplant operation, and Diane is forced to pick sides. Joseph treats a Bosnian woman who does not speak English, and is unaware of the full extent of her condition - but his decision to tell her the truth has disastrous consequences. After dealing with a medical emergency in the lab, Matt realises he misses treating patients.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: The arrival of arrogant new registrar Patrick Spiller makes a bad impression among staff, particularly Holly, who has crossed his path before. Adam receives a nasty reminder of Sam's accident, and the parachute jump proves eventful for a nervous Max. Claire Goose and Robert Gwilym star.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: A Small Price to Pay - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of three. Jack embarks on a relentless search for the gunman who shot Gary - and soon realises the finger of suspicion is pointing firmly at Adam's friend Isaac Collins. Smithy and Jonathan call at Gina's house to see why she hasn't turned up for work, and discover her unconscious on the bathroom floor. Away from the line of duty, Tony feels dejected at not having a date for Honey's birthday party and decides to hire an escort for the evening - little anticipating the surprise awaiting him.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Richard gets an unwelcome surprise from Cindy and Ian. Dot is in a happy mood as she looks forward to a special visitor. Nigel receives some bad news from Debbie via Clare.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Beth breaks Nigels weak and feeble heart and Michelle entrusts Shelly with Vicky, only to find out that shes exposed her daughter to a drug fuelled pot session.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Bluewatch are called to extinguish a fire at a school and find two missing boys. Meanwhile, Adriane falls down a flight of stairs during an argument with Nick.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Archie has to choose between giving his business partnership with Paul one last chance or going mountaineering in Nepal with his sister Lizzie to honour their father's memory. Meanwhile, Molly is angry that Andrew has ignored her since returning from their romantic weekend, but Golly gains the courage to admit his hidden feelings to her. Alastair Mackenzie and Susan Hampshire star.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Tom Beresford returns to Skelthwaite 20 years after a bitter family row, lured by the offer of a managerial position at Goddard's, and it's not long before he and his good-looking son are setting tongues wagging. Karen breaks all the rules to help two families come to terms with the consequences of a transplant operation, but her ill-advised actions backfire. Vic decides the time has come for a younger man to captain the Scorpions and an emotional Simon proposes to Anna. Drama, starring Tony Haygarth, Lesley Dunlop and Leslie Ash.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Connie and Oswald join the holiday to see Billy and Aveline, and Joey's protest about the game shooting on the estate wins him an admirer.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Peggy becomes a Yellowcoat, but her happiness is spoilt when Alec Foster arrives with bad news. Last-ever episode of the hit comedy, starring Su Pollard and Ruth Madoc.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean calls on Alistair's help to do a spot of match-making and Lionel finds himself in the middle of a muddle. Comedy, with Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The mischievous trio come to the aid of an old friend with an unusual medical problem, while Ivy becomes increasingly irate that no one will fix the cafe roof.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: Bacchus and Gently investigate a consignment of stolen passports, but the case takes an unexpected turn when a woman linked to the crime is found dead on the seashore with her mixed-race baby lying next to her. As the duo follow a lead on the murder victim's ex-boyfriend, they encounter racial prejudice and are drawn into an underground world of gang wars within the Arab community. Primeval's Andrew-Lee Potts guest stars.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The ex-coppers find themselves under the microscope when a psychologist arrives to conduct a study into older men in the workplace - but she soon reveals a more personal reason for her visit. It turns out that five years ago her brother, a cycle courier, was the victim of a hit-and-run that left him unable to recall anything prior to the incident. Now he says he was targeted for the parcel he was carrying, which was stolen at the scene - or so he believes. Sally Phillips guest stars.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The attempted suicide of a rape victim 12 years after her assault prompts Boyd to reopen the case, despite there being no new evidence. Their boss's illegal methods provide Grace, Spencer and the team with a suspect - but he quickly becomes aware the detectives are on his trail. Drama, starring Trevor Eve, with Ian Mercer, Michelle Dockery and Rory Kinnear.

programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits Montford Cottage in Pendle, Lancashire, where she discovers how the haven was created and reveals a few of her own horticultural secrets.

programme.desc: Elizabeth returns from hospital and is unimpressed with the way Regina is behaving towards George and asks her to leave, and Olivia and James decide that the best chance for their family lies in the city. Romantic drama, starring Noni Hazlehurst.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: George is delighted when Sarah agrees to marry him. When Elizabeth finds out about the proposal, she realises her threat to disinherit him has backfired - and decides to take a different approach. Elsewhere, Anna encounters complications with her pregnancy, and James and Olivia say goodbye to Harry before they leave Ash Park.

programme.desc: Tricia returns to the hospital and urges Mark to tell Chrissie the truth. Distracted by his personal problems, he makes a critical mistake while treating a patient. A film crew turns up to shoot a promotional video, Connie makes her choice over the supervisor's position, and Kyla is forced to bring her son into work, while Justin faces up to what he really wants.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A gas explosion disrupts the Christmas cheer in Accident and Emergency, while Max and Tina don't need any mistletoe to make the most of being stuck in a lift. Barney tries his best to arrive at a diagnosis of seven dwarves who appear to have been poisoned, and a visiting choir lifts the spirits of the staff and patients. Claire Goose and Robert Gwilym star.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: A Small Price to Pay - Part Three
programme.desc: Part three of three. Adam learns the Borough Commander has been sent photos of him smoking marijuana, and decides to resign before he's unceremoniously thrown off the force. Rochelle continues her steamy illicit affair with Dan, while Jack questions Neil about his relationship with Suzie Sim and receives a bland assurance that it's all professional and above board - but later sees the pair in a compromising position.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Michelle and Sharon's past comes back to haunt them, Nigel wallows in self-pity, Dot's grandson begins to fall from grace, and Gita battles with Richard.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Shelly tries to arrange a boozy drug fuelled party filled with Walfords finest scallywags at Michelles house and Pauline ruins Arthurs chances to get his leg over with Mrs Hewett.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Nick mounts a vigil at the unconscious Ariadne's bedside, while Hallam and George risk their necks to rescue a youngster trapped in the bedroom of a blazing house.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Lexie tries to run the estate in Archie's absence, but alienates Paul when she takes on more responsibility and makes matters worse when she agrees to sit on the board of a local distillery. Meanwhile, Duncan confronts Jess's ex-boyfriend and romance blossoms between Molly and Andrew, who plan to partition off a section of Glenbogle House so they can live together - breaking Golly's heart in the process. Susan Hampshire and Dawn Steele star.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Vic makes a shock announcement about his future, Tom proves his worth in a crunch match for the Scorpions and Karen and Beth help reunite an estranged family after a baby girl goes missing. Drama, starring Leslie Ash and Kerrie Taylor.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Adrian, who has been writing his memoirs, makes a decision that will change his life. Joey has reached the end of his tether.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: First episode of John Sullivan's comedy series, following the lives of Only Fools and Horses characters Boycie and Marlene. Denzil tells Boycie the infamous Driscoll Brothers are after the supergrass who had them jailed - prompting the car salesman to sell his business and move to rural Shropshire. John Challis and Sue Holderness star, with a guest appearance by Paul Barber.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Judith's former boyfriend Alistair rocks the boat by asking Sandy for a date, and Jean is given cause to feel jealous of Lionel. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy organises a weekend away near Scarborough - but Clegg is convinced it will end in disaster as Sid, Ivy and Compo's nephew Gordon are accompanying them. Comedy, starring Brian Wilde and Peter Sallis.

programme.title: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The detectives' case against a violent criminal is thrown into jeopardy by the murder of a key witness. Determined to secure a conviction, they immerse themselves in the seedy underworld of a seaside town, and as they press for answers, Havers is brought face to face with her childhood memories. Nathaniel Parker and Sharon Small star.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. When Eve finds evidence implicating her boyfriend, aid-worker Stefan, in murder, Boyd promises to support her and help get to the bottom of the mystery. But when it turns out her lover may also be involved in people smuggling, the pathologist becomes determined to prove his innocence, bringing her into conflict with her boss. Joseph Mawle guest stars, with Tara FitzGerald and Trevor Eve.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Sandra is reunited with an old flame when DCI Larson of the Met's arts and antiques squad asks her to look into the murder of an antiques dealer who was not quite as legitimate as everyone thought. Brian is puzzled by Esther's odd behaviour and her new-found interest in the internet, leading him to think the unthinkable - she must be having an affair. Paul McGann and Jesse Birdsall guest star, with Amanda Redman and Alun Armstrong.
