programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Anna is relieved when Gino believes she miscarried, and they spend the night together in the cottage before telling their families of their intention to marry. James sees a psychiatrist who agrees to treat his sexuality, Elizabeth worries that Regina is getting closer to discovering the truth about Sarah's past, and Jack is stunned to learn that he is Anna's father. However, a bigger shock is in store for those at Ash Park when a body is found in the river. Romantic drama, starring Marta Dusseldorp.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: An elderly Sarah reveals the truth about Bert Ford's death. Meanwhile in 1953, Sarah and Anna start their trial periods in their new homes, and Jack is furious at Carolyn for having kept their daughter a secret. Olivia becomes concerned over James's brutal hospital treatment and Elizabeth makes a shock announcement. Romantic drama, starring Marta Dusseldorp.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: A Small Price to Pay - Part Three
programme.desc: Part three of three. Adam learns the Borough Commander has been sent photos of him smoking marijuana, and decides to resign before he's unceremoniously thrown off the force. Rochelle continues her steamy illicit affair with Dan, while Jack questions Neil about his relationship with Suzie Sim and receives a bland assurance that it's all professional and above board - but later sees the pair in a compromising position.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Nick rushes an operation so he can deal with a more glamorous case - a pole dancer with a rare condition - and impress Connie. However, his plan backfires and leaves him facing accusations of negligence. Donna finds out Justin went to a strip club when he said he was at his mother's, and Joseph treats a man who may have brain damage - an experience that brings back painful memories.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Max's day gets off to a celebratory start as he and Amanda announce their engagement, but he soon gets into trouble with his blushing bride-to-be when she discovers he's been secretly giving methadone to a heroin-overdose victim. Charlie and Jan fail to keep their personal and professional lives separate when they fall out over security arrangements, and a circulating e-mail soon outs their closet affair to the rest of Holby A&E. Robert Gwilym and Derek Thompson star.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Jack takes over as superintendent in Adam's absence, and promotes Neil Manson to acting DCI - despite grave misgivings about his recent conduct. Gabriel publicly asks Sheelagh out for dinner, allaying her fears that their relationship is over, and Ramani is devastated to learn Terry has been having an affair with his sister-in-law. Affairs of the heart also preoccupy Dan Casper, who receives another poison pen letter - but decides to ignore it and continue his affair with Rochelle.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: It's Arthur's 50th birthday and Pauline is busy preparing for the celebrations but Mrs Hewitt feels left out. Cindy and Hattie have a massive argument.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Mrs Hewitt has given Arthur an ultimatum, he needs to tell Pauline he is leaving her today but Martin is ill. Nick asks Dot to move in with him and his family.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A grieving Nick struggles to come to terms with Ariadne's tragic death, while a raging timber-yard fire has serious consequences for Billy.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Lexie is furious that Dorothy has taken over the island in the middle of the loch for her latest business venture - a tai chi retreat - and enlists Golly to sabotage the scheme. Molly struggles to put her break-up behind her, and Paul is roped into the housework. Dawn Steele stars.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Jess fears she may be pregnant and Karen nervously prepares for a visit by one of David's old flames, the glamorous Evelyn Parrish. Joe makes a clumsy attempt to seduce Anna's nanny and winds up with egg on his face, while Kath is discovered unconscious and rushed into hospital, putting everyone else's problems into perspective.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Leonora announces she is pregnant, Lilo Lil brings Nellie news of Freddie's whereabouts, and Grandad dreams about his funeral. Last-ever episode of Carla Lane's sitcom.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Tyler and Marlene are not impressed by their new surroundings and want a swift return to Peckham, but Boycie warms to the idea of becoming a 'gentleman farmer', which seemingly involves doing little work and mingling with the country set. His manager Elgin persuades him to retain all his staff.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel suffers embarrassment when he walks in on Sandy in the bath, and once the sniggers subside Jean decides to have a second bathroom installed and calls in the builders. As the tension increases, she realises a minor incident has been turned into a major issue that she can ill afford.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The trio take a holiday at the seaside with Compo's miserable nephew Gordon, and attempt to cheer him up. Peter Sallis, Brian Wilde, Bill Owen and Philip Jackson star.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest investigates when the new wife of Sir Raleigh is found dead in a locked room after seeing an Egyptian mummy. Crime drama, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: The Doctor Blake Mysteries
programme.desc: Despite being housebound as he recovers from his injuries, Blake investigates the death of a teenage girl in the dressing room at the debutante ball.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team investigates the mystery of a missing scientist, after the man's wife receives a series of emails from someone claiming to know what happened to him. The physics professor was last seen in 2004, on a train to Paris for a conference, and when he disappeared he was working on a potentially lucrative cold fusion project that had attracted attention from many large organisations. However, as the detectives dig deeper, a shadowy Whitehall figure warns Sandra's boss Strickland they should drop the case.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Old adversary Linda Cummings taunts Boyd from inside a secure psychiatric hospital, leading the team to discover more murder victims within its confines. As his frustrations rise, Boyd needs help from Grace - but she has been mysteriously forced to take time away from the Cold Case Squad and handed the investigation over to an eminent psychologist who is an expert on Cummings. Guest starring Gina McKee, Ruth Gemmell and Alexander Siddiq.

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: A distraught Dr Napier berates herself for failing to diagnose a case of diphtheria, while Dr Cameron shoulders the melancholy task of attending an old friend who is hovering at death's door. Drama, starring David Rintoul.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: The medic temporarily hangs up his stethoscope to intervene in a confrontation between Irish farm labourers and irate locals who blame them for a typhus outbreak, resolving matters with a combination of tough talking and common sense. David Rintoul stars, with Ian Bannen and Annette Crosbie.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: A virtuoso violinist baffles Lovejoy by asking him to help pull off an elaborate con involving a fake Stradivarius - so he enlists an expert to find out what is going on. Whimsical drama, starring Ian McShane.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Snooker player Dennis Taylor asks Lovejoy for help finding a billiards table that once belonged to Mary Queen of Scots. Drama, also starring Ian McShane.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: Richard Sharpe becomes a pawn in a French plan to retain control of Spain, and finds himself facing execution for murder. Determined to regain his honour, he undertakes a dangerous quest to find the only person capable of clearing his name. Adaptation of Bernard Cornwell's novel, starring Sean Bean.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: The lads return to work on an ambitious engineering project, with new member Wyman filling in for his late, lamented dad Wayne. Reunited by Oz, who has secured the job of dismantling the world-famous Middlesbrough transporter bridge, they set about raising the necessary financial backing - but have a hard time persuading Dennis to join them. Dick Clement and Ian La Frenais' popular comedy drama, starring Jimmy Nail, Kevin Whately and Tim Healy.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: The lads begin work on dismantling the historic Transporter Bridge, but tension between the Serbian and Kosovan workers soon starts slowing things down - and worries about Bomber's health add to their woes. Elsewhere, Mickey Startup dispatches hitman Teddy Platt to teach Moxey the error of his ways, while Oz has an eye-opening reunion with son Rod. Dick Clement and Ian La Frenais's popular comic drama, starring Tim Healy, Kevin Whately, Timothy Spall and Jimmy Nail.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Rosemary's old school friend Dorothy invites the duo to restore the gardens of her beautiful villa on the French Riviera so the property can be opened to the public. The plan arouses bitter hostility among the neighbours and long-held family secrets start to surface, leading to murder. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo are hired to investigate why newly planted roses at an upmarket preparatory school keep dying. After witnessing the arcane ritual of the Night of the Stag, they detect tensions between modernising headmaster Quentin Marshall and established members of his staff who are harbouring secrets someone is prepared to kill for. Drama, guest starring Anthony Andrews (Brideshead Revisited), with Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The green-fingered sleuths are hired to work behind the scenes of a garden makeover TV show, but Rosemary has an accident while standing in for the programme's star and ends up in hospital. Realising someone is trying to sabotage the series, Laura teams up with no-nonsense presenter Quinnie Dorell (Belinda Lang) to catch the culprit. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: Philip Henderson is found dead in his field following an altercation the previous day with his neighbour Doug Randall about his failed crop. Suspicion falls on the neighbour and his new wife, who was known to have had ongoing problems with Philip over his unpaid bar tab at her pub. However, as Mike and the team dig further into the mystery more suspects come into play. Neill Rea stars.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: When a man is electrocuted during a typing contest with Crabtree and Louise Cherry, Murdoch suspects the reporter was the intended target.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: The death of a policeman in a Soho strip club introduces Gene and the team to their new boss, detective 'Super Mac'. After months of silence, Alex again starts receiving flashes from the present - as well as the attentions of a mysterious admirer - while Chris tries to impress Shaz with his credentials as a new man. Philip Glenister and Keeley Hawes star.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: A car chase ends with a fatal crash, and Gene is accused of causing death by dangerous driving, leading to increased tension with the local community. As Alex takes up the fight to prove her boss's innocence, she becomes concerned that he is being led into corruption by Super Mac - and to add to her problems, she begins to doubt her mysterious stalker's offer of a way home.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: Former colleague Julia Piper asks Kavanagh if he will fly out to the States and help her fight the appeal of a convicted murderer on death row. Once in the Land of the Free, he finds himself up against a governor determined to ensure sentence is carried out - and realises that where justice is concerned, the Americans sometimes just do not play cricket. Legal drama, starring John Thaw, Anna Chancellor and Lisa Harrow.

programme.title: Trial & Retribution
programme.desc: DI Pat North is assigned to look into a case that may clear a man convicted of murder eight years ago, and finds that DS Walker was in charge of the original inquiry. Drama, starring Kate Buffery, David Hayman and James Wilby.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the Headland Garden in Polruan, Cornwall - one of the participants opening its havens to the public in the National Gardens Scheme - where plants face the harsh conditions of salt air and high winds.

programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Mission Employable
programme.desc: Agent Kym takes on the challenges of a farmhand and discovers that there are lots of jobs to do there. For her first job of the day, she has to feed the calves.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Weasel tries for his AeroFizz pilot's license. Magoo ruins everything when, convinced he's fixing his roof, he pierces a hole in the airship..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz and Weasel shoot people with toy arrows to make them fall in love with Fizz. But Magoo mistakes them for a giant hornet..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz rehearses a dance number that'll make him a star. But when Weasel catapults him next door onto the roof, Magoo thinks he's a stray alien.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean digs up Bruiser Snr's medallion and rushes off to the local museum convinced he's found treasure..

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean pimps his car in order to prove to Declan - a rival in love - that Bean's car is better..

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: After an overpass collapses on the highway, Team Tennyson is in a traffic jam along with Simon Sez and family.

programme.title: The Epic Tales of Captain Underpants
programme.sub-title: Captain Underpants and the Horrible Hostilities of the Homework Hydra
programme.desc: Can George and Harold destroy homework by making sure it was never invented in the first place?.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: George takes the Spuds to the museum of mouldy cheese. Anna dares Dave to lick the cheeses on display..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Dave rescues an endangered donkey from the docks. Hiding it in the camper van, things take a turn when the donkey eats Gran's glasses.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: This time, the chef travels to south Wales, where he is accompanied by Michelin-starred chef Stephen Terry. James cooks a Welsh lamb ragu on a beautiful mountainside, and samples award-winning Welsh wine and organic Welsh chocolate. Later, he visits Shaun Hill at his renowned restaurant, The Walnut Tree.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott's culinary tour reaches North Africa and the Moroccan city of Marrakesh. He visits a restaurant famous for cooking whole lambs in an underground oven, has a masterclass from local chef Cedric, who shows him how to make traditional food with a fancy twist, and hits the main square for some street food. Throughout the show he prepares flat breads with tomato salsa, barbecue corn on the cob with local spice spicy ras el hanout and whole fish with chermoula.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner prepare potato curry, rhubarb crumble and asparagus with Hollandaise. Gino D'Acampo cooks chicken in beer in Sardinia and The Great British Bake Off's Jane Beedle demonstrates a gluten-free roulade.

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the 14th series of nationwide talent search, which sees a wide variety of acts, from comedians to contortionists, singers to spoon players, compete for the chance to win 250,000 and a coveted slot at the Royal Variety Performance. Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and David Walliams are once again on hand to judge this week's applicants, and each of them has the chance to put their favourite contestant straight through to the live semi-finals by awarding them the Golden Buzzer.

programme.title: Twister (1996)
programme.desc: A storm-chaser and her estranged husband are brought together in a joint project to monitor the path of an oncoming tornado - but the pair face a race against the clock as a rival government-backed group with hi-tech resources tries to beat them to it. Action thriller, starring Helen Hunt, Bill Paxton, Cary Elwes, Jami Gertz and Philip Seymour Hoffman.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which members of a baseball team from Newport answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge. They then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Ben Shephard invites music legend Tito Jackson, actress Faye Brookes (Corrie's Kate Connor) and Good Morning Britain weather presenter Laura Tobin to take part in a special edition of the quiz show, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the better their chances of collecting the 20,000 prize for their selected charity.

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: In this edition, Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show from Swansea, setting members of the public unusual challenges for a chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to 1,000 in the big finale game.

programme.title: The Family Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents the special edition of the game show in which four relatives team up - this week the Holt family from Lanarkshire - and pit their wits against one of the finest quiz brains in the country, in the hope of taking away thousands of pounds.

programme.title: The Good Karma Hospital
programme.desc: The team members are hit hard by a life-or-death emergency, forcing Gabriel to face his true feelings. Lydia's determination to help Jyoti get better comes at a great personal cost to the doctor. Ted seeks closure as he prepares to leave India. Medical drama, starring Amanda Redman, James Krishna Floyd, Kenneth Cranham and Sayani Gupta.

programme.title: Belgravia
programme.desc: The conclusion of Julian Fellowes' drama about secrets and lies in uptight 19th-century London society. James travels to Manchester to investigate the allegations made against Charles, but soon realises there are greater threats at play. Lady Templemore employs Reggie to make Lady Maria change her mind, but her daughter will not give in so easily. Susan is in danger of losing everything after her secret is revealed, but as ever she uses her cunning to twist the situation to her own and others' benefit, while Charles is puzzled to receive a mysterious olive branch. Keen to end the feuding, he seeks out the offer of reconciliation - unaware he is being lured into danger.

programme.title: Exposure
programme.desc: Jonathan Maitland presents an undercover report on the fast-growing sport of white-collar boxing, whereby people with little or no experience of fighting train to appear in special bouts, often for charity. Two undercover reporters attend training sessions at gyms in Leeds and London to find out how safe it is for those who take part.

programme.title: Ross Kemp: On the NHS Frontline
programme.desc: First of two programmes in which Ross Kemp follows frontline medical staff in Milton Keynes Hospital Trust as they prepare for and face the coronavirus pandemic. He witnesses the sacrifices staff and their families are making in their battle against the disease. And he follows the journey of patients admitted into the hospital's respiratory ward with mild symptoms, through to the intensive care units, where those with severe Covid-19 fight for their lives.

programme.title: You've Been Framed!
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates a comical selection of mishaps filmed by viewers. Highlights include a man accidentally throwing a hammer through his patio door, a young couple interrupted during a romantic proposal and a woman in labour who decides to play a prank on her midwife.

programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: The chef is joined by Brian Turner to explore the culinary delights of his native Yorkshire, with James visiting Frances Atkins' restaurant The Yorke Arms, where he enjoys her signature dish al fresco in her unusual dining room the Onion. Brian tastes the delights of some local charcuterie and is challenged to some off-road driving, while James brushes up his clay-pigeon shooting skills.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: A team of five colleagues answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Chris, Jane, Shanice and Bernard pit their wits against a ruthless quiz genius in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: On her first day of chemotherapy, Vanessa urges Charity to stay home and look after a sick Moses, but Kerry's appearance at the hospital makes Charity see red. Harriet and Will suggest to Dawn that she asks the social worker for advice on the issues she's been having with Lucas, while Mandy reveals more of her history with Paul to Lydia.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Asha's horrified when Dev forces her to attend Mary's youth volunteering group tidying up Victoria Gardens and feels the eyes of the world on her. Ken acquires proof that Charles deposited all payments from the Stillwaters residents into his personal bank account, while Carla agrees to take charge at the Rovers.

programme.title: Coronavirus: Q&A
programme.desc: Nina Hossein puts viewers' questions on a range of subjects relating to the Covid-19 outbreak to a panel of expert guests.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: The team are in Hackney, where they surprise Jeroume and Onessa Cariazo, the parents of wheelchair-bound nine-year-old Elijah, who has rare genetic condition myotubular myopathy. Alan Titchmarsh, Katie Rushworth, Frances Tophill and David Domoney give Elijah the sensory stimulation he craves, transforming the family's uneven overgrown urban courtyard into an accessible paradise complete with tropical water feature, a sensory beach and Asian-style dining zone.

programme.title: A Mother's Son
programme.desc: First of a two-part drama, starring Hermione Norris, Martin Clunes, Paul McGann and Alexander Arnold. The murder of a schoolgirl rocks the residents of a quiet coastal town in Suffolk, and when Rosie stumbles upon a pair of bloodstained trainers hidden in her home, she suspects someone in her family may have been involved in the killing. With her son Jamie and stepson Rob both acting suspiciously, could she be right?.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Gordon, Gino and Fred: American Road Trip
programme.sub-title: Summer of Love (San Francisco and Napa Valley)
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay, Gino D'Acampo and Fred Sirieix head to San Francisco, the free-spirited capital of the United States. They start out by sampling the latest trends of using cannabis in cooking, which was legalised in California in 2018 - but as they enjoy a hippy afternoon tea, Gino overindulges and chaos ensues, especially when the next activity on the agenda is a session of goat yoga. Moving on, the trio dig for clams on the Pacific coast, take a hot-air ride to a vineyard and visit a factory in Chinatown where fortune cookies are made. It seems a competition is in order and so the travel companions see who can make the most cookies in 60 seconds.

programme.title: All Elite Wrestling: Dynamite
programme.desc: Action from the latest edition of the weekly AEW event, featuring all of the biggest stars on the roster, including Adam Page, Chris Jericho, Cody and Jon Moxley.

programme.desc: Vernon Kay hosts the quiz show in which contestants' pulses are monitored and they must complete seven rounds before their hearts beat 1,000 times to win 25,000 - meaning they will have to stay calm under pressure or risk losing the jackpot.

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Martin's GMC report requires he passes three refresher courses which will then decide whether he is deemed fit to practice, starting with phlebotomy. Meanwhile, Louisa focuses on her new career as a child and adolescent counsellor. Much to Bert's dismay, Al hires Caitlin, and confesses to his accidental proposal.

programme.title: A Very British Lockdown: Diaries from the Frontline
programme.desc: Documentary featuring a wide cross-section of people as they record their own stories on camera phones - charting the everyday courage, kindness, anxiety and humour they experience as the nation strives to 'Keep Calm and Carry On'. From shopkeepers to home-schooling parents, care workers to cleaners, teachers to nurses, the film reveals what HM The Queen recently called 'our quiet, good humoured resolve'. Others - such as expectant Mums and the sick and elderly - show their bravery in the face of the coronavirus.

programme.title: A Mother's Son
programme.desc: Concluding the two-part drama, starring Hermione Norris, Martin Clunes, Paul McGann and Alexander Arnold. In the aftermath of the murder and the discovery of the bloodstained trainers, Rosie's distress starts to affect her family life and cracks begin to form. Meanwhile, David has learnt their son Jamie has been mixing with violent dropout Sean and fears he may have fallen under his influence.

programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Home Alone with Joel Dommett
programme.desc: The comedian hosts a special programme from his own home, featuring celebrity call-ins to comedy interviews and games with fellow self-isolated viewers.

programme.title: Kate & Koji
programme.desc: When Kate's flashy ex-husband Dennis arrives in town with his much younger wife, Kate feigns an attachment to Koji. Councillor Bone is sure their relationship is a front, but that does not stop a good old-fashioned show down at the pub. Comedy, starring Brenda Blethyn, Jimmy Akingbola and Barbara Flynn.

programme.title: Belgravia
programme.desc: The conclusion of Julian Fellowes' drama about secrets and lies in uptight 19th-century London society. programme.title: Barging Round Britain with John Sergeant
programme.desc: The broadcaster takes in the delights of the Lancaster Canal, setting out from Tewitfield. As he meanders down the waterway, John cannot resist visiting Carnforth railway station, where he re-enacts his favourite scene from the classic film Brief Encounter, some of which was filmed there. After Carnforth, the canal crosses the River Lune on its way to Lancaster, where the veteran journalist marvels at the engineering of the Lune Aqueduct. Later, he heads south to Garstang, famous for its cheeses, and finally on towards Preston.

programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Charity hopes to claw her relationship with Vanessa back from the brink, but Vanessa remains angered by her behaviour the day before and plans a birthday night out for Rhona as she tries to escape the reality of her condition. Dawn is crestfallen to see how well the foster parents seem to get on with Lucas and is no longer sure having custody is the best thing for them, while Moira wonders what's going on with Cain.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Gary intervenes in Amy and Kelly's fight and Asha finally realises who she can trust, while Ken tells Claudia that Stillwaters will never be his home and Johnny feels uneasy leaving Scott at the Rovers.

programme.title: Kate & Koji
programme.desc: Not for the first time, Kate is being sued, but this time by Councillor Bone. Koji discovers he is under investigation for working illegally, and things do not improve when he tells Kate what he really thinks about her grandson. Comedy, starring Brenda Blethyn and Jimmy Akingbola.

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: Paul meets a hyperactive staffie called Cookie, who training staff believe could make an excellent working dog, but this is not usual for staffies, so finding someone to take him on may be difficult. Paul also meets a two-year-old Dogue de Bordeaux in need of some love after being found abandoned in a park, and nine-month-old teacup poodle Charlie is having trouble running with her broken leg. Head vet Shaun explains that Charlie has three breaks on one leg, and the best thing for her is going to be to remove it.

programme.title: Our Queen at War
programme.desc: How the life of the young Princess Elizabeth was shaped by the events of the Second World War, and the extraordinary experiences she went through during her teenage years. The film draws on archive material and interviews with people who shared her experiences, and royal experts explore how she was transformed from a shy princess into Queen Elizabeth II and Britain's longest reigning monarch.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs show that tackles the issues behind the headlines from a Scottish perspective.

programme.title: The Martin Lewis Money Show
programme.sub-title: The Martin Lewis Money Show - A Coronavirus Special
programme.desc: The financial concerns resulting from the coronavirus.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: As Britain and Europe remain locked down in the fight against Covid-19, Julie Etchingham asks how seriously the food supply chain is being affected. Crops will be ready to be harvested in the coming weeks, but there may be no labour available. She looks at how shops, supermarkets and delivery services are coping now the early panic buying is over. And she asks, if vulnerable families cannot get access to food at prices they can afford, will people ultimately be forced to change the way they eat?.

programme.title: Gordon, Gino and Fred: American Road Trip
programme.desc: For the final leg of their US jaunt, the trio arrive in Texas, a meat-lover's paradise where Gordon Ramsay is keen to introduce his companions to some of the best barbecue food known to man. In Lexington, Gordon turns lumberjack in an attempt to fell a dead oak - which is used to infuse ovens with wood smoke. There's a break for a bit of skinny dipping, before the trio fish go fishing, and stay in a strange cabin deep in the woods, surviving on beans and bourbon. They then hit the state capital of Austin, dressing as cowboys in the local bar and at the rodeo, before one last barbecue supper of slow-smoked beef brisket, pork ribs and spicy sausage.

programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Piers Morgan's Life Stories
programme.desc: Piers sits down for an interview with renowned professional footballer Cristiano Ronaldo.

programme.title: Stuck on You: The Football Sticker Story
programme.desc: How four Italian brothers took a childhood obsession and turned it into a worldwide multi-billion pound industry - and the British upstarts who took on the mighty Panini to beat them at their own game.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: In Northern Ireland, James and local boy Paul Rankin brave the Carrick-a-Rede rope bridge together, then James cooks a tasty fish dish with the dramatic coastline as his backdrop. There's a fishing trip over to Rathlin Island on the menu too, where James tastes some dishes made from the local kelp. The duo then visit the Old Lammas Fair, where they taste some of the delicious seafood, before James cooks up a delicious boozy sweet treat using some of Ireland's tastiest liquor.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.sub-title: Oche Oche Oche, Oi Oi Oi!
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which A family of five with a shared love of darts answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Vanessa asks a big question of Charity, but the answer fails to help the situation, while Billy suggests to Dawn that she reaches out to Manpreet for some support. Will hears that Carol and Ted's visit upset Dawn, and Belle is horrified to realise that her salon appointment is at the same time as Andrea's.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Asha implores Dev not to go to the police about the video, while Gary finds Kelly in tears and is startled to learn she was thrown out of school. Geoff engineers a row between Yasmeen and Cathy after reading a pamphlet on domestic abuse with a list of signs of controlling behaviour.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: Young physiotherapist Lizzie Faulkner is shot dead while enjoying a holiday at a luxury country retreat. The resulting murder investigation unearths betrayal, guilt and the desire for atonement - as Vera moves quickly to avoid another tragedy, and Joe tries to make amends with the demons of his past. Crime drama, starring Brenda Blethyn, David Leon, Paul Ritter and Eva Quinn.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Piers Morgan's Life Stories
programme.desc: Michael Parkinson finds himself on the opposite side of the talk show format, as he discusses his life and career with Piers Morgan. The veteran host looks back on his encounters with some of the world's biggest stars, including Fred Astaire and Madonna, as well as what is perhaps his most famous moment, a powerful series of interviews with Muhammad Ali. He also reflects on his roots in a Yorkshire mining village, the death of his father, and his struggle with alcohol and the impact it had on his otherwise successful 60-year marriage.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Warwick Davis hosts the quiz, in which a team of five answer questions about top 10 lists then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Will they have what it takes to head home with the 125,000 cash?.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz and Weasel set up their super-antenna in the desert. Magoo ends up beside them. He mistakes the antenna for a forest's last oak tree..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Hidden inside a robot, Fizz and Weasel hack the world's Internet server, but Magoo, shopping the sales, mistakes it for a shopping cart and takes it..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz is recording chill music to de-stress the world, so he needs quiet. Unluckily, Magoo's come over to borrow a wrench and thinks there's a leak..

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean is forced to baby-sit Mrs. Wicket's Nephew on an Outward Bound day course..

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The hapless buffoon heads out on a camping trip, but his knowledge of wild animals proves less than worthy.

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: At Biggie Box Japan, Ben waits in an epic line for the release of the latest Sumo Slammers video game, Cyber Slammers.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Dave is given a bulb to grow. Popping it in his lunch box, it isn't long before he discovers it's partial to Betty's sandwiches..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: George adapts the spin cycle of the washing machine causing a black hole to form in the Spuds' kitchen..

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: Highlights from past episodes, including recipes from chefs Parveen Ashraf, Shaun Hill, Richard Bertinet and Francesco Mazzei, and James taking a trip to Snowdonia and making lunch for Jane Seymour. Plus, James prepares spiced lamb, cookies and the ultimate ham and cheese sandwich and cooks lunch for Jane Seymour.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: The chef is joined by Brian Turner to explore the culinary delights of his native Yorkshire, with James visiting Frances Atkins' restaurant The Yorke Arms, where he enjoys her signature dish al fresco in her unusual dining room the Onion. Brian tastes the delights of some local charcuterie and is challenged to some off-road driving, while James brushes up his clay-pigeon shooting skills.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott's culinary tour reaches North Africa and the Moroccan city of Marrakesh. He visits a restaurant famous for cooking whole lambs in an underground oven, has a masterclass from local chef Cedric, who shows him how to make traditional food with a fancy twist, and hits the main square for some street food. Throughout the show he prepares flat breads with tomato salsa, barbecue corn on the cob with local spice spicy ras el hanout and whole fish with chermoula.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: DCI Tom Barnaby reluctantly joins wife Joyce on a spa weekend at Swavely Manor, a country house offering treatments to soothe the mind and body. However, as he attempts to unwind, a woman is found dead in a flotation chamber and he promptly abandons his therapy to investigate - but the body count soon rises. The detective eventually wraps up the case, but it proves to be his last as he makes a big decision about his future. John Nettles' final appearance in the long-running series, with guest stars Ronni Ancona, Geraldine James and Lesley Manville.

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Ben Shephard invites comedian Joel Dommett, reality star Lydia Bright and actress Sarah Hadland to take part in a special edition of the quiz show, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the better their chances of collecting the 20,000 prize for their selected charity.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as celebrity contestants Katherine Ryan, George Shelley, Faye Brookes and Bobby Davro pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in this obstacle-course challenge, hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara. Members of the public compete alongside celebrities Rickie Williams, Melvin Odoom and Laura Crane, and those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK.

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: In this edition, Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show from York, setting members of the public unusual challenges for a chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to 1,000 in the big finale game.

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the 14th series of nationwide talent search, which sees a wide variety of acts, from comedians to contortionists, singers to spoon players, compete for the chance to win 250,000 and a coveted slot at the Royal Variety Performance. Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and David Walliams are once again on hand to judge this week's applicants, and each of them has the chance to put their favourite contestant straight through to the live semi-finals by awarding them the Golden Buzzer.

programme.title: Through the Keyhole
programme.desc: Radio DJ and TV presenter Marvin Humes, Good Morning Britain's Kate Garraway, and comedian Jimmy Carr form the panel this time, as Keith Lemon is given another chance to rummage around the homes of three more mystery celebrities. As he tours the home, he points out items and features that might offer clues to the owners' identity, and challenges the studio panel to come up with the right answer to the question, 'who habitates in a house like this?'.

programme.title: The Departed (2006)
programme.desc: A cop infiltrates the inner circle of a feared Boston mobster, unaware a fellow officer is already an informant on the gangster's payroll. When both the crooks and the police discover they have a mole in their ranks, the two detectives realise they are in sudden danger and try to expose each other. Martin Scorsese's Oscar-winning thriller, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Matt Damon, Jack Nicholson, Mark Wahlberg, Martin Sheen and Alec Baldwin.
